name: More 1980s Movie Trivia Online Trivia | Movies Grab Bag | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the 1987 movie "The Witches of Eastwick", Daryl Van Horne said that a woman blossoms when faced with the three Ds.  Which of the following Ds is NOT one of the three Ds?
questions.explanation:
Deception.

	The devil comes to Eastwick, Massachusetts, to stir things up for three lonely women.  Jack Nicholson starred as the devil opposite Cher, Susan Sarandon, and Michelle Pfeiffer in this comedy.

questions.text: In "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids", which of the following balls broke the window activating the shrinking machine?
questions.explanation:
Baseball.

	Ronnie Thompson was playing baseball and hit it over into the Szalinski's yard, breaking the window, to Wayne's work room.  The baseball provided the last necessary component to make the machine work.  This 1989 family comedy starred Rick Moranis, Matt Frewer, and Marcia Strassman.

questions.text: "Popularity can be spooky.." was the tagline for which of the following teen comedies?
questions.explanation:
Teen Witch.

	This tagline sets the tone for this teen comedy.  Robin Lively starred as Louise Miller, a young, unpopular high school girl who desperately wants to be popular.  She soon finds out that she is a teenage witch.  She uses her powers to become popular and get the best looking guy in school, Brad Powell, who is played by Dan Gauthier.  This film was supposed to be a girl version of "Teen Wolf" because it had a lot of similiarities in the ad designs and plot lines.

questions.text: Which of the following ladies from the sitcom "Alice" starred in the 1984 comedy horror "Gremlins"?
questions.explanation:
Polly Holliday.

	Polly Holliday played Mrs. Ruby Deagle in this Joe Dante and Christopher Columbus film about little green monsters that terrorize a small town.  She played Florence Jean Castleberry on "Alice" from 1976 to 1980.  She left the show to do her own spin-off "Flo" in 1980 which only lasted one season.  She can also be seen in "Mr. Wrong" (1996), "The Parent Trap" (1998), and "Mrs. Doubtfire" (1993).

questions.text: In the movie "Three Men and a Baby" what was the name of the little girl who Peter, Michael, and Jack had to take care of?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	This 1987 comedy was one of the top box office hits of that year. It follows three bachelors who get stuck babysitting a young girl and end up giving up their night lives. It was followed up in 1990 with a sequel called "Three Men and a Little Lady".

questions.text: Which of the following '80s movies starred Gene Wilder and Gilda Radner?
questions.explanation:
Haunted Honeymoon.

	This 1986 comedy centered around a young couple getting married at a family estate surrounded by several spooky events.  During their career together, Gene and Gilda also starred together in "Hanky Panky" and "The Woman in Red".

questions.text: In this 1981 comedy Dan Aykroyd and John Belushi starred together as a wild con-man and a straight-laced businessman, who end up living next to each other on the same block.  What is the name of this film?
questions.explanation:
Neighbors.

	"Neighbors" was the last film that John Belushi starred in before his untimely death on March 5, 1982.  Dan and John starred in the comedy classic "The Blues Brothers" in 1980.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct sequel name to the series of "Police Academy" movies?
questions.explanation:
Police Academy 3: Back in Training.

	The correct names of the sequels are as follows:  "Police Academy 2: Their First Assignment"; "Police Academy 3: Back in Training"; "Police Academy 4: Citizens on Patrol"; "Police Academy 5: Assignment Miami Beach"; "Police Academy 6: City Under Seige" and "Police Academy 7: Mission to Moscow".

questions.text: What type of dinner did Molly, Gina, and Val make for C.J. and Killer on their last night at Shagri-La in the 1987 comedy "The Allnighter"?
questions.explanation:
Lasagna.

	This college comedy starred Susanna Hoffs, DeeDee Pfieffer, and Joan Cusack as roomates sharing one last night together.  The girls made lasagna with a little zip and had one crazy night to remember before they graduated from Pacifica College.

questions.text: What was the name of Debbie's ex-boyfriend in the movie "Bachelor Party"?
questions.explanation:
Cole Whittier.

	Robert Prescott played the ever annoying Cole Whittier who tried to sabatoge Rick and Debbie's plans to wed.  He has also starred in other 80's hits such as "Real Genius", "The Joy of Sex" and "Spaceballs".
